children.subject:
From https://registrar.berkeley.edu/academic-records/grades:

If you earned a grade of D+, D, D-, or F, and have taken the course only once:

  • You must take the course for a letter grade.
  • Both grades will show on your transcript, but only your most recent grade will be calculated into your GPA.

So you won't be able to P/NP it, and the D will show up on your transcript, but your GPA will only be affected by the retake.

history.content:
I took Data 100 last semester, and due to laziness and not turning in work, I got a D. I know the material well (Got 1SD above on the midterm and .5 SD above on the final), so it would be a relatively simple class. Would it be worth it to retake the class? I would have a 3.3 without it vs a 3.1 with it, so I probably wouldn't be able to get into grad school either way, and don't really have plans to. Next semester would be my last, and I'm taking a breadth and CS 160.

Also, would I be able to p/np it to get the effect on GPA removed?
history.subject: Retake Data 100?
